title: $5 for all the iD Keen games!
content:
[url=http://steampowered.com/v/index.php?area=game&AppId=9180&cc=NZ#]steampowered.com/v/index....180&cc=NZ#[/url]

That's Vorticons and Galaxy (not Dreams or Babysitter), all for five measly bucks. What a great way to show your appreciation for all those cool Keen games you pirated back in the day!

</spam>


(I've already shown my appreciation in the form of Flash animations - free entertainment for those dudes who made such awesome games that I didn't have the money or transaction methods to purchase them with at the time.)----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!

title: Re: $5 for all the iD Keen games!
content:
Wow, just wow! I seriously never thought I'd see this day. Games that old getting added to steam. It's too bad that there's still no way to purchase Keen 6.

EDIT: I wonder if they have been edited from the original, you'd expect them to run under XP if they release them like this.
EDIT2: Just read from somehwere that DOSBox is being used fro running these games, interesting seeing as no credit is given anywhere.

title: Re: $5 for all the iD Keen games!
content:
Interesting. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] The price is certainly not bad, good to see old games for suitable prices. I wonder what version are they? Probably the Vorticons are 1.31 and then Galaxy 1.4. It's very good to see something related to the official games, like this. It could create some interest in Keen again, and perhaps finally the rights could end up to Tom's hands. And anyways, as it's almost 20 years since the release of the games, the re-run culture gets interested in the early 90s soon, and then! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: $5 for all the iD Keen games!
content: I guess they use 1.31 vorticons and the goodtimes software version for galaxy.

title: Re: $5 for all the iD Keen games!
content:
I almost fell out if my chair when I went to play Counter-Strike Source and saw Commander Keen on Steam.

$63 for id's entire catalog isn't too shabby.------------------
http://www.smbc-comics.com/
Digg.com

title: Re: $5 for all the iD Keen games!
content: Is there any good reason why Aliens and Dreams aren't included?

title: Re: $5 for all the iD Keen games!
content: Yeah there is, that being id doesn't own the rights for those games. Aliens rights are held by Atari (?), and Keen Dreams by Softdisk.

title: Re: $5 for all the iD Keen games!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Yeah there is, that being id doesn't own the rights for those games. Aliens rights are held by Atari (?),[hr][/quote]
No I don't believe that's right. I don't remember what and how but iD could sell Keen 6 it they wanted to.-----------------

content:

title: Re: $5 for all the iD Keen games!
content:
Sigh Davinci, what isn't owned is free. Keen 6 isn't free, it's illegal to download it. Someone or some company does own the rights. -----------------

title: re:
content: After a series of consolidations, it's officially owned by Atari. Of course, this Atari isn't the same Atari of the past, but simply Infogrames with a name change.

title: Re: re:
content: I am led to wonder what kind of inane contracts id signed back in the day that gave the rights to those titles to their publishers.

title: Re: re:
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Also, I thought the rights to Keen Dreams belonged to "some dude in Louisiana".[hr][/quote]
